Overview on how to run this Project

  1. Either install a Python IDE or create a Python virtual environment to install the packages required
  2. Install packages required
  3. Install Spinex

Setup procedure

  1. Configure project environment (Either A. Install Pycharm OR B. Create a Virtual Environment)
    1. Install Pycharm (www.jetbrains.com/pycharm/download/)
      • Open the eab(EASYBUY) Directory (File -> Open)
      • Configure the Base Project Interpreter (File -> Settings -> Project Interpreter)
      • Base Project Interpreter: pyenv version 3.6.2 (‘path to .pyenv version 3.6.2’/bin/python) (pyenv was installed before creating the new project through ‘pyenv install 3.6.3’)
  2. Create a Python Virtual Environment
    • Install virtualenv:
      sudo pip install virtualenv
    • Create virtialenv:
      virtualenv -p python3
  3. Run
    python manage.py runserver

Endpoints of the EASYBUY!

  1. Browse the website
  2. Quick view the prodcut
  3. Add product
  4. Go to checkout

EASYBUY Home

Checkout

we've created an array that stores the quantity and the name of the cart item. So, if the cart is empty then the else loop will execute and the quantity will be set to 1. And, if the cart is not empty then the if loop will execute and the quantity will be incremented by 1. We are using the index number to access the quantity of the items from the array. Therefore, we need to replace cart[idstr] with cart[idstr][0].
Then we made a model for the orders and migrate it, We need to handle to orders in the views.py order = Orders(items_json= items_json, name=name, email=email, address= address, city=city, state=state, zip_code=zip_code, phone=phone) order.save(). After this, we need to define the HTTP method and CSRF token in the form of the checkout.html file.

Payment

For Payment process, we tried to integrated Paytm gateways. Before integrating the payment gateways we had fetch the total amount into our existing model (models.py) We add a new object named "amount(amount=models.IntegerField(default=0))" and migrate the changes in the database then added "" for reciveing the amount also write the jQuery function in the template(checkout.html) $('#amount').val($('#totalPrice').html()) we create a new directory for Paytm integration. In the shop folder and create a new directory named Paytm. Inside this directory, created a new file named "Checksum.py." After this, we went to the Github repository of the Paytm.we found find the following files on the Paytm repository : Checksum.py response.cgi test.cgi Now, we need to make some changes in the checksum file. Type ".encode('utf-8')" after "key", "IV" and "to_encode".
